title: Novel Pneumonia Risk Score (PRS)
desc: The Novel Pneumonia Risk Score (PRS) predicts radiographic pneumonia in children.

orgreference.text: Lipsett SC, Hirsch AW, Monuteaux MC, Bachur RG, Neuman MI. Development of the novel pneumonia risk score to predict radiographic pneumonia in children. Pediatric Infectious Disease Journal. 2022;41(1):24-30.

data.evidence:
The probability of radiographic pneumonia is calculated based on the following inputs:

  • Age, years
  • Fever* at home or in ED (yes or no)
  • First O2 saturation obtained
  • Crackles (yes or no)
  • Wheezing (yes or no)

% risk of radiographic pneumonia = ex/(1+ex)*100

where x = 18.05624 + 0.098308*(Age, years) + 1.144985*(Fever) - 0.21636*(First O2 saturation obtained) + 0.407494*(Crackles) - 0.907087*(Wheezing)

Pneumonia Risk Score (PRS):

% Risk of Radiographic Pneumonia Pneumonia Risk Score (PRS)
<5% (low) 1
≥5% and <11% (low) 2
≥11% and <21% (medium) 3
≥21% and <51% (medium) 4
≥51% and <75% (high) 5
≥75% (high) 6

*A fever is defined as >38°C (>100.4°F).
